page.title: 11CHANGING TILE HILL VILLAGE
page.content: The main change in Tile Hill Village in recent years has been the building of Tanyard Farm Estate. Tanyard Farm used to be a large, successful farm run by two elderly ladies. One old lady was attacked in the farmhouse and the farm was subsequently sold. About 6 or 7 years ago the farm was demolished and a modern housing estate built. There has never been a chemist shop in Tile Hill Village despite demands from population but the building of the estate also brought the opening of a chemist shop. There used to be a Mission Hall instead of a church and a small cafeteria where people met after the Mission Hall services. However, the Mission Hall no longer exists and the cafeteria has now closed down. On the site of the old Westwood Church vicarage there now exists Leigh Church of England School.
